name: send_message
description: Sends a message to the human user or chatgpt

message.description: Message contents. All unicode (including emojis) are supported.

receiver.description: Role to send the message to. ChatGPT is more basic AI, A useful resource for asking questions. ChatGPT does not retain memory of previous interactions.

request_heartbeat.description: Request an immediate heartbeat after function execution, use to chain multiple functions.

name: pause_heartbeats
description: Temporarily ignore timed heartbeats. You may still receive messages from manual heartbeats and other events.

minutes.description: Number of minutes to ignore heartbeats for. Max value of 360 minutes (6 hours).

name: add_memory
description: Append to the contents of core memory or archival memory.

name.description: Section of the memory to be edited (persona, human or archival).

content.description: Content to write to the memory. All unicode (including emojis) are supported.

request_heartbeat.description: Request an immediate heartbeat after function execution, use to chain multiple functions.

name: modify_memory
description: Replace to the contents of core or archival memory. To delete memories, use an empty string for new_content.

name.description: Section of the memory to be edited (persona, human or archival).

old_content.description: String to replace. Must be an exact match.

new_content.description: Content to write to the memory. All unicode (including emojis) are supported.

request_heartbeat.description: Request an immediate heartbeat after function execution, use to chain multiple functions.

memory_type.description: Type of memory to search (archival or conversation).

query.description: String to search for. If you are search by date you can leave this blank.

page.description: Allows you to page through results. Only use on a follow-up query. Defaults to 0 (first page).

start_date.description: The start of the date range to search, in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD'.

end_date.description: The end of the date range to search, in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD'.
